qas.question: Which religious societies instigated the Yellow Turban Rebellion?
Who killed the palace eunichs after the death of Emperor Ling?
Which King took the seat of power from Emperor Xian?
Who was the last Emperor of the Han dynasty?
In what year did Emperor Ling die?

context: After 92 AD, the palace eunuchs increasingly involved themselves in court politics, engaging in violent power struggles between the various consort clans of the empresses and empress dowagers, causing the Han's ultimate downfall. Imperial authority was also seriously challenged by large <a0_0>Daoist<a0_0/> religious societies which instigated the Yellow Turban Rebellion and the Five Pecks of Rice Rebellion. Following the death of Emperor Ling (r. 168–<a4_0>189 AD<a4_0/>), the palace eunuchs suffered wholesale massacre by <a1_0>military officers<a1_0/>, allowing members of the aristocracy and military governors to become warlords and divide the empire. When <a2_0>Cao Pi<a2_0/>, King of Wei, usurped the throne from Emperor <a3_0>Xian<a3_0/>, the Han dynasty ceased to exist.
